                          C  L  A  S  S  I  C
Official Website: http://www.squidsoft.net
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Star Conquest is a multiplayer role-playing game set in interstellar
space, as well as on dozens of planets, space stations, and starships.
Your goal is what you want it to be.  There are many different ways to
make a living.  And you won't be alone; all your activities take place
with your choice of three diverse unions as a backdrop.  And when you
finally work your way up to one of the greatest powers in interstellar
space, a fourth alliance of certain humans and some alien species may
begin trying to recruit you.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Open to the public since 19 December 1998!
All original work located in this game is copyright (c) SquidSoft.net 1998-2009,
unauthorised reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
NOTICE: Star Conquest: Classic is offered mainly for the purposes of nostalgia
and will receive MINIMAL support. Go to Star Conquest at telnet://squidsoft.net:
7777 for a more active development experience and to play the game as it is
meant to be!
The last server reset was at Tue Apr  4 22:33:21 2017 UTC
Contact us via email at: starconquest@squidsoft.net
Please log in now.
If you do not have a SquidSoft.net account and wish to create one, please send a
web browser here: http://moo.squidsoft.net:3333/

    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Starship "Blueberry"; Living Quarters One]
Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on fuchsia status.  Looking through
the windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a wooden wardrobe, a wicker rocking chair, a throw rug, a walnut canopy
bed with a lavender silk bedsheet, a floral pattern silk bedsheet, a lilac silk
blanket, and a lavender silk pillow on it, a large storage chest, a storage
container, a yellow storage locker, a pink mirrored vanity, a shaker chair, a
cedar dresser, a pair of platform jellies, and a pair of skimpy pink lace bikini
cut panties here.
Lileah Rose is asleep.
You can go out.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The one-person cargo hauler "Hauler3", the one-person cargo hauler "The
Harvina", the one-person supply shuttle "Unreality Programming 584", the
one-person supply shuttle "Unreality Programming 45", the one-person cargo
hauler "Debris Monster", the one-person cargo hauler "Sexy", the eight-person
journeyer "Blueberry", and the two-person light freighter "Sandbagger" are
landed here.

medical drone, a spherical security drone, a shiny blue medical drone, Jamie the
droid, a message drone, Liz the droid, Ernest the droid, Nef the droid, Lacey
the droid, Boe the droid, Hjelp the droid, a small trash can, Nick the droid,

drone, a spherical security drone, Erant the droid, a giant seizure-inducing
claw machine, a large deluxe tent, Kratos the droid, Nia the droid, Keira the
droid, Page the droid, Sami the droid, a spherical security drone, a polished

[Starship "Sandbagger"; Control Room]
You see an FTL drive tracer, a sector debris scanner, a large beanbag chair, and
a large leather lounge couch here.

power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
launch
The navigation systems are nonfunctional until their power is restored.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You notify flight control of your desire to launch.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Sandbagger, you have clearance to
launch.  Good luck and come back to us safe."

dock
The Jinu starship "Yuuijuminlakiltra" has a docking bay large enough to contain
this ship.  You can request entry into its docking bay, or dock in the usual
manner by connecting to the docking ring near the control room.
Would you like to request entry into the docking bay?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
Request for entry into Yuuijuminlakiltra's docking bay sent.
Yuuijuminlakiltra accepts the entry request.
You feel a bit of acceleration as the ship begins docking procedures.
You hear a solid thud as the ship sets down in a larger ship's docking bay.

windows, you see that the ship is in space.

a large leather lounge couch here.

dock
The Jinu starship "Yuuijuminlakiltra" has a docking bay large enough to contain
this ship.  You can request entry into its docking bay, or dock in the usual
manner by connecting to the docking ring near the control room.
Would you like to request entry into the docking bay?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y

Official Website: http://www.squidsoft.net
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Star Conquest is a multiplayer role-playing game set in interstellar
space, as well as on dozens of planets, space stations, and starships.
Your goal is what you want it to be.  There are many different ways to
make a living.  And you won't be alone; all your activities take place
with your choice of three diverse unions as a backdrop.  And when you
finally work your way up to one of the greatest powers in interstellar
space, a fourth alliance of certain humans and some alien species may
begin trying to recruit you.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Open to the public since 19 December 1998!
All original work located in this game is copyright (c) SquidSoft.net 1998-2009,
unauthorised reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
NOTICE: Star Conquest: Classic is offered mainly for the purposes of nostalgia
and will receive MINIMAL support. Go to Star Conquest at telnet://squidsoft.net:
7777 for a more active development experience and to play the game as it is
meant to be!
The last server reset was at Tue Apr  4 22:33:21 2017 UTC
Contact us via email at: starconquest@squidsoft.net

                          C  L  A  S  S  I  C
Official Website: http://www.squidsoft.net
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Star Conquest is a multiplayer role-playing game set in interstellar
space, as well as on dozens of planets, space stations, and starships.
Your goal is what you want it to be.  There are many different ways to
make a living.  And you won't be alone; all your activities take place
with your choice of three diverse unions as a backdrop.  And when you
finally work your way up to one of the greatest powers in interstellar
space, a fourth alliance of certain humans and some alien species may
begin trying to recruit you.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Open to the public since 19 December 1998!
All original work located in this game is copyright (c) SquidSoft.net 1998-2009,
unauthorised reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
NOTICE: Star Conquest: Classic is offered mainly for the purposes of nostalgia
and will receive MINIMAL support. Go to Star Conquest at telnet://squidsoft.net:
7777 for a more active development experience and to play the game as it is
meant to be!
The last server reset was at Tue Apr  4 22:33:21 2017 UTC
Contact us via email at: starconquest@squidsoft.net

web browser here: http://moo.squidsoft.net:3333/

metaf I've landed.
[(Frequency 373.88)] Rolando Caganda transmits, "I've landed."
peer out
You peer out...
[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The Spaceport of New Earth's capital city stands over a breathtaking crystal
clear bay which lies at the tip of the southern continent. The Landing Pad
itself is a huge, square sheet of plasteel, suspended by pillars over the water.
Ships surround you, and the bustle of daily business overwhelms your senses. To
the west you can see a bridge spanning the gap to the main building of the
Spaceport.
The one-person cargo hauler "Hauler3", the one-person cargo hauler "The
Harvina", the one-person supply shuttle "Unreality Programming 584", the
one-person supply shuttle "Unreality Programming 45", the one-person cargo
hauler "Debris Monster", the one-person cargo hauler "Sexy", the eight-person
journeyer "Blueberry", and the two-person light freighter "Sandbagger" are
landed here.
You see an acclimated vegetation dispenser, Brooke the droid, a shiny blue
medical drone, a spherical security drone, a shiny blue medical drone, Jamie the
droid, a message drone, Liz the droid, Ernest the droid, Nef the droid, Lacey
the droid, Boe the droid, Hjelp the droid, a small trash can, Nick the droid,
Athena the droid, Winston the droid, Tarah the droid, a spherical security
drone, a spherical security drone, Erant the droid, a giant seizure-inducing
claw machine, a large deluxe tent, Kratos the droid, Nia the droid, Keira the
droid, Page the droid, Sami the droid, a spherical security drone, a polished
marble-sized EAOS prototype security drone, a shiny blue medical drone, a shiny
blue medical drone, a spherical security drone, a spherical security drone, a
spherical security drone, a spherical security drone, a spherical security
drone, a spherical security drone, a spherical security drone, a shiny blue
medical drone, a spherical security drone, Kim the droid, Ellen the droid, a
spherical security drone, a spherical security drone, a shiny blue medical
drone, a shiny blue medical drone, Faith the droid, Toney the droid, a spherical
security drone, a spherical security drone, a spherical security drone, a
spherical security drone, a spherical security drone, a spherical security
drone, Jenny the droid, a flawlessly reflective spherical sea-green medical
drone identified as "Adrienne", Chewie the droid, Cherry the droid, Shippy the
droid, a shiny blue medical drone, and an orangutan here.
Jack Greenwood and Angelique Waverly are asleep.
You can go north, west, and down.

slowly brought into the ship's hold.
The debris is now secured in the ship's hold.  Scanning reveals it to be an old
engine casing.

                          C  L  A  S  S  I  C
Official Website: http://www.squidsoft.net
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Star Conquest is a multiplayer role-playing game set in interstellar
space, as well as on dozens of planets, space stations, and starships.
Your goal is what you want it to be.  There are many different ways to
make a living.  And you won't be alone; all your activities take place
with your choice of three diverse unions as a backdrop.  And when you
finally work your way up to one of the greatest powers in interstellar
space, a fourth alliance of certain humans and some alien species may
begin trying to recruit you.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Open to the public since 19 December 1998!
All original work located in this game is copyright (c) SquidSoft.net 1998-2009,
unauthorised reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
NOTICE: Star Conquest: Classic is offered mainly for the purposes of nostalgia
and will receive MINIMAL support. Go to Star Conquest at telnet://squidsoft.net:
7777 for a more active development experience and to play the game as it is
meant to be!
The last server reset was at Tue Apr  4 22:33:21 2017 UTC
Contact us via email at: starconquest@squidsoft.net
Please log in now.
If you do not have a SquidSoft.net account and wish to create one, please send a
web browser here: http://moo.squidsoft.net:3333/

Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Tue Jul 18 12:11:18 2017 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!

1
    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Starship "Kalliste"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a gray leather captain's chair and a wormhole drive tracer here.
You can go south and out.
(You are lying down.)

accumulated!

[League Salvage Processing Nuclear Autonav Station; Docking Bay]
A small, basic docking bay is the core of the station, along with the life
support system and resource storage. Small hatches lead to the other station
modules.
The two-person medium transport "Kalliste" is parked here.
You can go north, east, south, up, and down.

A bit of debris is snagged by the starship's electromagnetic field projector and
slowly brought into the ship's hold.
The debris is now secured in the ship's hold.  Scanning reveals it to be a
drifting cloud of tritium.

7
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: Debris.
[General Communication] Evenia an Eachtrannach transmits, "It's no wonder I
didn't recognize the name of that transport. I've never seen it salvage!"
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
[General Communication] Evenia an Eachtrannach chuckles.
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Kalliste!
Welcome to home space!"

[0m#OK. {^The computer announces, "%*"} IS NO LONGER AN ACTION.[0m
[Space Explorers Amidst The Stars] Constantine Stone transmits, "Hmm. I
definitely looked at the org asset list before the station shut down, and we
still had 980 then."
The ship's computer automatically requests landing clearance.
sal
You instruct the computer to begin scanning for debris.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Hello, Kalliste. We read your AEU
transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of New Phoenix."
A bit of debris is snagged by the starship's electromagnetic field projector and
slowly brought into the ship's hold.
The debris is now secured in the ship's hold.  Scanning reveals it to be a
single spacesuit glove.
power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
out
out

Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Tue Jul 18 12:11:18 2017 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!

               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The

extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new

citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.

l
[Starship "Kalliste"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights

[The Torus; Dock Alpha]
The pale gray walls, floor, and ceiling of this massive EAOS docking bay glow
with a pale white light. Though the bay remains open to space, it somehow also
retains its atmosphere. Outside, you can see the bright glint of a solitary
blue-white star. Signs indicate that the repair and rearm facility, the starship
supply store, and the main concourse are to the north.
The three-person clipper "Firestorm" is landed here.

[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at The Torus; Dock Alpha.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
Constantine Stone is standing here.
You can go south, up, and out.

sal
You instruct the computer to begin scanning for debris.
A bit of debris is snagged by the starship's electromagnetic field projector and
slowly brought into the ship's hold.
The debris is now secured in the ship's hold.  Scanning reveals it to be an
abandoned storage pod.

Everyone does the ground part for a nest."

kiss lileah
You kiss Lileah Rose.

slowly brought into the ship's hold.

drifting cloud of tritium.

apparently this really detailed space part we didn't know about."

dock
The Jinu starship "Yuuijuminlakiltra" has a docking bay large enough to contain
this ship.  You can request entry into its docking bay, or dock in the usual
manner by connecting to the docking ring near the control room.
Would you like to request entry into the docking bay?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
Request for entry into Yuuijuminlakiltra's docking bay sent.
Yuuijuminlakiltra accepts the entry request.
You feel a bit of acceleration as the ship begins docking procedures.
You hear a solid thud as the ship sets down in a larger ship's docking bay.

stand
out

[Starship "Sandbagger"; Airlock]
You can go out and into the ship.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
The computer announces, "Beginning cycling."
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from green to yellow.  Through
your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.
You have been credited with 6.5808 Jinu credits for your find.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
red.
out
You may not leave the airlock while it is cycling.
out

here.

enter sand

[Starship "Sandbagger"; Airlock]
You can go out and into the ship.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from red to yellow.  Through
your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.
The computer announces, "Cycling complete."
use bag
You are currently wearing portions of a spacesuit, do you wish to unsuit now?
y
[Enter `yes' or `no']
You remove the elements of your spacesuit and fold them neatly into a standard
starship flightbag.
enter
[Starship "Sandbagger"; Control Room]
You see an FTL drive tracer, a sector debris scanner, a large beanbag chair, a
large leather lounge couch, and some black leather boots here.

l egil
Egil Aurstad
He appears to be 27 years old. He is about five feet and ten inches tall and has
freckled skin. His body is thin with plain hips and thin calves. He has sloping
shoulders and a narrow chest. His face is long and subtly asymmetrical, with a
pointed nose and sharp chin. His lips are flat and brownish red and occasionally
part to reveal a set of gapped teeth. Beneath a set of wild eyebrows, his eyes
are blue and widely-set. His short, wavy hair is blonde and neatly combed. He
has short clear fingernails.
 He is wearing a standard grey shipsuit and a pair of shiny black boots. He is
also wearing a keychain, a message board reader, a portable newsfeed aggregator,
a barely functional metachannel FTL communicator, a small cloth sack, and a
black flightbag. His head, face, both eyes, both wrists, and both hands are left
uncovered.
He is carrying a copy of "Starships and Upgrades: Fringe Edition" in his right
hand.

l
[Starship "Second Chances"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship
is in space.
You see a temporary wormhole drive and a crudely hammered scrap metal feeding
trough here.
You can go north and south.
With everything arranged, you settle into the damage control station.
[PA] Lexie Amarras: "Ok then yes grab a turret Egil."
[PA] Nathaniel Owens: "Hold up."
[PA] Nathaniel Owens: "We're not going on the fort yet."

received 140,196.35 EAOS credits from a toll payment to League Rift Accelerating
Solar Toll Station in The Belt of Orion.
[PA] Lexie Amarras: "Yeah, but theree'll be fighters or something first. Lay me
odds."
[PA] Nathaniel Owens: "Egil, do you know how to make things die?"

launch
You tongue a prominent control inside your battlesuit, then brace yourself as
two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
The pod shudders violently as it speeds through the interior of the enemy
structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
With a sudden burst of thrust, the drop pod slows abruptly. There is another
thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.

commands
Combat/Support
Command                                                Function
gp.....................................................Dual Gravitic Projector
gl.....................................................Gravitic Lance
pb.....................................................Proximity Bomb
yel....................................................Yellow Glyph       
(Projects a yellow glyph.)
red....................................................Red Glyph          
(Projects a red glyph.)
dsp....................................................Dispel Glyph       
(Dispels all friendly glyphs.)
rep....................................................Repair Drone       
(repair drone)
eb.....................................................Energy Bottle      
(energy bottle)
cover..................................................Move Into/Out of Cover
General
Command                                                Function
launch.................................................Launch To/From Mission
Area
damage.................................................View Damage
weapons................................................View Weapons/Ammo
equip/unequip..........................................Manage Modular Equipment
enter..................................................Transfer to Empty
Battlesuit/Vehicle
exit...................................................Exit Battlesuit/Vehicle
contact................................................Contact Aerial Fortress
(only possible at certain locations)

Combat/Support
Command                                                Function
gp.....................................................Dual Gravitic Projector
gl.....................................................Gravitic Lance
pb.....................................................Proximity Bomb
yel....................................................Yellow Glyph       
(Projects a yellow glyph.)
red....................................................Red Glyph          
(Projects a red glyph.)
dsp....................................................Dispel Glyph       
(Dispels all friendly glyphs.)
rep....................................................Repair Drone       
(repair drone)
eb.....................................................Energy Bottle      
(energy bottle)
cover..................................................Move Into/Out of Cover

Command                                                Function
launch.................................................Launch To/From Mission
Area
damage.................................................View Damage
weapons................................................View Weapons/Ammo
equip/unequip..........................................Manage Modular Equipment
enter..................................................Transfer to Empty
Battlesuit/Vehicle
exit...................................................Exit Battlesuit/Vehicle
contact................................................Contact Aerial Fortress

[Starship "Second Chances"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a square white rattan coffee table with a glass top here.
Lexie Amarras, Nathaniel Owens, and Egil Aurstad are standing here.
You can go south and out.

questions till you're questioning your own questions."

Can you shut the fuck up?"

An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 14
Destroyers:
Three-Person Light Escort 15,000,000.00 (New Earth Blazing Trails)
AS-0A AEU LIGHT ESCORT VESSEL
Class: Destroyer
Requirements: 50 industry points        15 combat points
Model number: AS-0A                     Designation: Light Escort
Turret hardpoints: 10                   Launcher hardpoints: 1
Standard storage capacity: 20000        Standard battery hours: 10
Docking bay size required: 40
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 105%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Max Cruising Speed: 102%
The light Escort is the first destroyer that an AEU pilot will ever have access
to. It's a reasonably well armed vessel, with no major bonuses. However, it can
still pack quite a punch, especially with more advanced upgrades and its single
launcher.
Three-Person Heavy Defense Vessel 7,500,000.00 (Endymion)
AD-1N AEU HEAVY DEFENSE VESSEL
Class: Destroyer
Requirements: 100 industry points       250 combat points
Model number: AD-1N                     Designation: Heavy Defense Vessel
Turret hardpoints: 12                   Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 20000        Standard battery hours: 4
Docking bay size required: 40
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 105%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Max Cruising Speed: 102%
The defense vessel is a very well armed vessel, holding 12 turrets. It does have
a major disadvantage though, which likely also explains the cheaper cost. That
disadvantage is that it has no FTL drive. However, it can still be a very useful
ship, but just know if you want to take it anywhere you'll need to dock it
inside a bigger ship, or tug it around using a tugboat.
Three-Person Clipper 200,000,000.00 (New Earth Allied Technologies)
AS-4F AEU CLIPPER-CLASS ESCORT VESSEL
Class: Destroyer
Requirements: 750 industry points       750 combat points
Model number: AS-4F                     Designation: Clipper
Turret hardpoints: 12                   Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 20000        Standard battery hours: 14
Docking bay size required: 40
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 105%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Max Cruising Speed: 102%
The Clipper is the most advanced destroyer that the AEU has. It's as armed as
the defense vessel with 12 turrets, but has the further advantage of a vastly
increased engine speed when it's going at maximum burn, and also has an extra
hull failsafe over the other two destroyers.

l
[Starship "Kalliste"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. The status lights overhead are
currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is in a garage.
You can go north.

leather phone holster, a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, and a gold
wrist-mounted chronometer. You are concealing a metallic silver metachannel FTL

accelerator network."

skim acceleration gates now."

The computer announces, "Two."
The computer announces, "One."
The computer announces, "Skim subroutine initialized."
You feel the deck underneath you shudder violently, and you stumble slightly.
The shuddering finally settles down.
The computer announces, "Skim initialization complete."

[1] The Shoulder of Orion (Unclaimed)
[2] The Belt of Orion (Unclaimed)
Enter your selection:
2
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
f9pvNNN*I9--j+2|^}D/ywvlB=D+ht*pz4K\tYGx
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to League Salvage Processing Nuclear Autonav Station in thirty seconds
unless aborted or another navigation order is entered."
The computer reports that the opochtli "I Was Too Dumb To Think Of A Name For
This Ship" has performed an emergency jump with heavy wormhole drive damage.
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Firestorm.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."

tra gen Hello all
[General Communication] Shule Elemmire, Phoenix Dissident transmits, "Hello
all."
l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

[The Torus; Dock Alpha]
The pale gray walls, floor, and ceiling of this massive EAOS docking bay glow
with a pale white light. Though the bay remains open to space, it somehow also
retains its atmosphere. Outside, you can see the bright glint of a solitary
blue-white star. Signs indicate that the repair and rearm facility, the starship
supply store, and the main concourse are to the north.
The three-person clipper "Firestorm" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine here.
You can go north and down.

l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

It's also more of a risk than it might be worth depending on what you use it
for."

You can go out and enter into the ship.
Tara Flores followed you.
You exit the ship.
[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The scout "Dreamseeker II", the two-person light transport "Rhino", and the
four-person light carrier "Star Of Destiny" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
Tara Flores followed you.
disband
You disband your group.

boards it. They flash again as the airlock closes.

[Starship "Star Of Destiny"; Control Room]
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a shiny
round deep amethyst table with a painted tablecloth in a vivid patchwork
pattern, a large oval dark purple and light purple cloth rug, and a rare black
EAOSian contoured couch here.
You can go south and out.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Star Of Destiny, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."

proceed to The Torus (Dock Alpha) in thirty seconds unless aborted or another
navigation order is entered."

AutoStar (general-purpose starship autopilot) Version 9.1
--
Destinations in this sector:
   Space Stations:
[1] The Torus (Dock Alpha)                                  
[2] The Torus (Dock Beta)

[4] The Torus (Dock Delta)

[5] Space Market

Enter your destination:
Via general sector communication, The Torus transmits, "Greetings, Star Of
Destiny! Welcome to The Torus!"
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: The Torus (Dock Alpha).
The ship's computer automatically requests docking clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "We detect you to be an AEU ship, Star
Of Destiny. The EAOS welcomes you under the non-aggression pact."
power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.

l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

[Starship "Star Kittens"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a tyrian purple destination finder, a glossy dark red ceramic felo chow
bowl, a felo nest, Curie the humanoid service robot, an obese light violet
glowing felo, a large violet felo, an obese violet sabre-toothed felo, a large
light violet glowing felo, a hefty light violet sabre-toothed felo kitten, and
an old large white felo here.
You can go south and out.

The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.

ftl chetumal
What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.
The planet of Chetumal floats before you here, the richest planet among the
Fringe Worlds, although that isn't saying a lot.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Chetumal in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."

FTL Interalliance Communications Network
--
Subject: Telepathic Felo
Author: Morris Corlew
Posted: 13:46 22 July 2317 GST
--
This is not a trade, but an offer. I would like to see what's up with these
felo, so am spreading the word. There is a breed of felo that has popped up that
seems to be at least somewhat telepathic. Sometimes when they eat, those nearby
will see an image in their mind of the plant that used to be their main food
source on Grenwold. They show some other traits too, staring intently at one
another and at us. I have been breeding them and have at least two that I know
for sure that are kittens at the moment of writing. If anyone is interested in
helping me figure out if there's anything other than the telepathy with these
guys...if perhaps they can lead us to a way to help them be healthier...please
let me know in a letter. I repeat that this is an offer and I am not charging
for these guys. If you want to make one a pet, you will need to purchase tonic
at the Torus.
--
[1] Previous
[2] Return
[3] Reply
[4] Quit
--

You peer out...
[Chetumal Spaceport; Landing Pad]
Carved out of the top of one of the old mountains north of Chetumal City, the
landing pad of this spaceport has an unmatched panoramic view of the
countryside. A low cliff shelters it on the north side, with mail, security, and
repair facilities built into it, and recent construction efforts have expanded
the area and given it a sleek new look. The pad itself consists of a patchwork
of heavy plasteel panels bordered by beams of lighted steel, the panels
variously sized to accommodate any model of starship, no matter how large or
small. A modern but somewhat noisy hydraulic system moves starships between the
landing pad and the garage below. On the south side of the pad is the pilot
lounge with large, tinted windows overlooking the fine Chetumalian landscape to
the south. You can GO into its sleek glass-framed doorway. There is also a
doorway here marked 'Liaison Office,' which you can also GO into. A doorway to
the south leads to the Salvage Reclamation Project Center, and a wide metal
stairway leads down into lower levels of the spaceport.
The three-person clipper "Firestorm" and the one-person flitter "Fringe Navy
Flitter Corps Red 4" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine, a long row of cinder blocks, a trash can,
and a sanitation drone here.
You can go north, northeast, south, northwest, and down.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
[AEU | 1: Alliance Communication] Constantine Stone transmits, "Ther<'s on{ in
Landfall."
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Firestorm, you are given launch
clearance under the AEU-Fringe non-aggression pact."
The computer reports that the one-person flitter "Fringe Navy Flitter Corps
Orange 3" has landed on the planet Chetumal.
ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Firestorm!
Welcome to home space!"

[New Phoenix; Mexico Lane]
The scent of Mexican foods drifts toward you from the northwest. The AEU's
blackened tower looms above the smallish buildings here, but no one seems to pay
it any mind. The buildings seem to be mainly restaurants and wholesale shops.
Even though the entire area is rather dingy and poor-looking, as if the
colonists from the third world areas of Old Earth simply recreated their old
life here on new soil, it seems to have suffered little from the war. Business
is lively and the sounds of conversation in old languages can be heard all along
the street.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The one-person skimmer "Unreality Programming 402" and the three-person clipper
"Firestorm" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.

addressed!

to read it.

focus on one or the other.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The three-person clipper "Firestorm" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine, a small trash can, and a sanitation drone
here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
Your ship 'Firestorm' has been automatically moved into a garage.

activity underway, but no performance goals reached yet! Let's keep going!"

l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."

The perfect ring of The Torus spins serenely nearby.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically

navigation order is entered."

Welcome to The Torus!"

Enter your destination:
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: The Torus (Dock Alpha).
The ship's computer automatically requests docking clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "We detect you to be an AEU ship,
Firestorm. The EAOS welcomes you under the non-aggression pact."
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.

clearance under the AEU-EAOS non-aggression pact."
ftl orion
The ship is already moving.
ftl orion
The ship is already moving.
ftl orion
Which sector did you mean?
[1] The Shoulder of Orion (Unclaimed)
[2] The Belt of Orion (Unclaimed)
Enter your selection:
2
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
\DnyJ]8zU:>6$"YEg_'~<bdFS?RQKETWhZhO(S.M
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to League Salvage Processing Nuclear Autonav Station in thirty seconds
unless aborted or another navigation order is entered."
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Firestorm.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."

ftl chetumal
What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.
The planet of Chetumal floats before you here, the richest planet among the
Fringe Worlds, although that isn't saying a lot.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Chetumal in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."
Via general sector communication, Chetumal transmits, "Greetings, Firestorm!
Welcome to Chetumal Orbit!"

open purse
You open a golden Feng Wo coin purse.
l purse
a golden Feng Wo coin purse
This small golden silk brocade coin purse folds at the top, where it is secured
with a hidden snap.
It is open.
Inside it you see a pile of eight golden tael, three silver tael, a pile of

get package
You remove a small package from a leather briefcase.
open package
A small package is already open.
l package
a small package
This is a package. It is addressed to Shule Elemmire, Phoenix Dissident, and was
sent by Melinda Michaels.
It is open.
Inside it you see a letter and a letter.
get letter from package
You remove a letter from a small package.
read letter
--
yo,
So, the real issue here is you took some time to make this decision to come
home. You could have been forming a letter for me to bring home during the
several hours in which Akemi informed you I was coming and the time that I got
to Andy's.
You did not then have to come home and try to put this on me. I did not rush
you. You had many hours to decide this stuff. I even asked you, before I left,
if these are the things you wanted me to relay back home. You said yes.
Yes I was upset when I left because somebody was murdered, another beaten, arson
to a library and one of mine stabbed. It didn't matter who requested you come
home. What mattered was, crap was going down and you weren't coming, at that
time, because people of your alliance did not ask for you specifically.
I was not rude to you nor did I pressure you into not giving a statement by
leaving quickly. You could have easily said hold on, let me write something
while you eat. You could have said, rest a little bit and let me think on this
issue. You did none of these things and then tried to make it look like it's my
fault for not giving you time.
Yes I am upset by that because I only came out there to help and get this shit
thrown in my face as thanks. I am mostly upset because of this. I should have
never found you guys at Andy's, you should have been on your way home and I
don't care whose ship it is. Important things were going on here.
Melinda

l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
[General Communication] Evenia an Eachtrannach snickers.
[General Communication] Rogue Pilot Eli Grey transmits, "Maybe, but I'm not
obese!"
i
 You are wearing a short-sleeved oceanside blue linen shirt, a pair of slim
Sahara sand linen trousers, and a pair of gray canvas sneakers. Underneath this,
you are wearing a pair of white cotton briefs and a pair of white socks. You are
also wearing a keychain, a backpack, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black
leather phone holster, a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, and a gold
wrist-mounted chronometer. You are concealing a metallic silver metachannel FTL
communicator, a flight control scanner, a large expandable telescoping xenology
container, a scorched metal thigh holster, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a camera
bag, a black engineering tool case, a black flightbag with a red shooting star
on the side, a leather briefcase, and a thick synthleather bandolier with large
pockets. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, both
wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.

high-quality construction, finished with notched lapels, matching buttons, and
fine but unobtrusive stitching for a look both casual and casually dressy.

Rogue Ace Pilot Ather Jammoa stands off to one side and slightly behind Eli and
glances around, his optics unit clicking and whirrring quietly.
Eli holds up a photo of the destroyed AEU headquarters in New Phoenix.
Eli Grey says, "This is a photo of the destroyed headquarters in New Phoenix, it
was destroyed during Outsider bombardments and still stands like this today, a
grim reminder of those days. The Outsiders may be gone from our space for now,
thanks to the Accord, but we've yet to speak of these drones on this broadcast."
Eli Grey says, "These drones were used by the Outsiders to occupy human worlds.
Cold, calculating machines that insured that humanity abided by the Outsiders
rules. Doubtless many of you already know this, though it seems it bears
repeating."
Eli looks gravely into the camera, "In fact many of these drones are still
active on human world's. civilian pilots are deployed on missions to destroy
them, and destroy the transmission towers that issue their orders. they reside
in areas where reconstruction hasn't even begun yet, because of their presence.
"
Eli Grey says, "They are combated through the use of armored battlesuits,
created and distributed through the cooperation of Masterson with the Accord.
Without these battlesuits humanity was unable to drive them from our worlds. It
was these very same battlesuits that allowed humanity to finally claim victory
of the alien mothership in the final battles of the resistance."
Eli Grey says, "These suits, have gone on to help humanity with other problems
as well. They are regularly used to destroy Replicator nests, as well as keeping
the vents of the Old Frontier Processor clear of bari, allowing for civilian
pilots to mine for valuable resources and have even been used to combat
occupation by human terrosts. None of which would have been possible without the
combined knowledge and power of the alliances working through the Accord.
Without the Accord,  these suits simply would not exist, and neither would
humanity."
Eli allows the words to hang in the air for a moment, staring seriously into the
camera. He turns briefly to appraise his fellow pilots and then back to the
camera, nodding.
Eli's face grows sad as he speaks, "the withdrawl from the Accord, also means
that non-Union people living on Union world's will be forced from their homes,
and offworld, according to the recent headlines.
"No matter how you may feel about other alliances, the people that live on Union
worlds are our friends, our neighbors." Eli Grey shakes his head as if to
himself. "Doubtless many of you know one or more of these people. Perhaps they
cut your hair, or sell you your groceries? Do we really want this for them? If
you are saying 'What do I care about a bunch of non-Unioners?'then consider
this, these people spend credits here. they pay their rents, buy our products
and even contribute to their local communities. How will such a loss in our
economy affect all of us? this is yet another reason that leaving the Accord is
a bad plan for the future of the Union."
Eli Grey says, "It's been shown recently that the Accord will continue to allow
the Union pilots to use their facilities upon withdrawl. This may put some of
you at ease, hoever this access is meanginless without the Union actively
contributing. The combined contributions of all alliances through the Accord is
the only thing currently keeping human space safe."

l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

ftl new
The ship is already moving.
ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Firestorm!
Welcome to home space!"

ftl hyperion
A single star shines brightly in the dark here, the light strangely comforting.
The ship's sensors indicate that the star's spectrum is nearly identical to
Sol's.
Hyperion's famous Sea of Grass is immediately obvious upon gazing at the planet,
the rolling, meters-deep expanse of tall grasses obscuring the contours of the
surface.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Hyperion in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."
Via general sector communication, Hyperion transmits, "Hello there, Firestorm!
Welcome to home space!"

[Hyperion; Sea of Grass Road]

[Hyperion; Sea of Grass Road]
Gentle winds blow the high grasses back and forth, occasionally strongly enough
to push it into your path. The road is in obvious bad repair, but you don't pay
it much mind, keeping your eyes on the horizon. Faint sounds of animal life can
be heard over the wind. On the west side of the road the grass has been
trampled, and you can see a faint trail leading from here through the grassy
countryside. In addition, a bright red and white sign on the other side of the
road points the way down a clear path to the Felo Sanctuary to the east.
You can go north, east, and south.
e
[Hyperion; Sea of Grass]
You can go east and west.
l
[Hyperion; Sea of Grass]
Long grass waves in the breeze along this straight path. Though the path is
unpaved, the dirt has been packed down and is marked by faint vehicle tracks.
The air is fresh and cool. About a quarter-mile away to the east, a white
warehouse-like building stands up out of the waving grass.
You can go east and west.
e
[Hyperion; Sea of Grass]
l
You can go east and west.
[Hyperion; Sea of Grass]
This quiet path is framed by tall grass waving in the wind. The air is fresh but
smells occasionally of wet fur. A large white warehouse stands up out of the
grass about a fifth of a mile to the east. Above the grass in a generally
northwestern direction, you can see the faint gleam of the spaceport.
You can go east and west.

[Hyperion; Sea of Grass]
This quiet path is framed by tall grass waving in the wind. The air is fresh but

[Hyperion; Felo Sanctuary]

l
[Hyperion; Felo Sanctuary]
The path ends here in a clearing in the tall grass. The clearing is only twenty
feet wide, as though whoever made it wanted to have as little impact on the
environment as possible. On the east side of it is a squarish white building,
its plain facade decorated with a painted arch formed of the colorful
silhouettes of small cat-like creatures. In the center of the wall is a small
door with a large sign that you can LOOK at beside it and a bright red box
marked 'Donations!' beneath it. Extending from the building into the grass on
either side is a very high square-link fence which leaves narrow open spaces on
either side where the interior of the compound is visible.
You can go west.

l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at Hyperion; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
**
 Welcome back to Star Conquest!

focus on one or the other.

l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at Hyperion; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Firestorm, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."

ships
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
There are no other ships in the sector.
ships
There are no other ships in the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to AFW Command (Dock One) in thirty seconds unless aborted or another
navigation order is entered."
ships
There are no other ships in the sector.

"Hello, Firestorm. Welcome to Accord space."

i
 You are wearing a lightweight navy wool suit jacket, a long-sleeved white
cotton dress shirt, a pair of pleated front slim fit navy wool dress pants, and
a pair of black patent leather oxfords. Underneath this, you are wearing a pair
of white cotton briefs and a pair of black silk socks. You are also wearing a
keychain, a backpack, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone
holster, a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, and a gold wrist-mounted
chronometer. You are concealing a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator,
a flight control scanner, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a
scorched metal thigh holster, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a camera bag, a black
engineering tool case, a black flightbag with a red shooting star on the side, a
leather briefcase, and a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets. Your
head, face, both eyes, neck, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.
